DOC.brief_summary: Participants randomly assign one two group . Group A : oral supplementation 4,000 IU vitamin D ( cholecalciferol ) . Group B : oral supplementation 400 IU vitamin D ( cholecalciferol ) . Both treatment consume daily 6 month . Outcomes evaluate baseline , three six month . Variables relate leptin resistance evaluate . The main hypothesis vitamin D diminish leptin resistance overweight obese woman . If hypothesis confirm , woman show reduction Resting energy expenditure : serum Leptin ratio ( REE : Leptin ratio ) , well reduction hunger , body weight , body abdominal fat increase rest energy expenditure .
DOC.brief_title: Supplementation With Vitamin D Improves Leptin Resistance
DOC.detailed_description: Study subject get dietary advice physical activity counseling . At end study , participant suboptimal vitamin D level ( < 80 nmol/L 25-OH-D ) receive treatment normalize vitamin D status . Variables relate leptin resistance like rest metabolic expenditure , hunger , body weight human body fat assess . Outcomes include , glucose , insulin , C-reactive protein , inflammatory interleukin ( IL-6 & TNF-α ) non-inflammatory interleukin ( IL-10 & TGF-β-1 ) .
DOC.criteria: BMI : 2529.9 Serum vitamin D level : 2080 nmol/L ( 25OHD ) Liver disease Kidney disease Diabetes mellitus Malignity Any kind hormonal disorder Medication modify hunger/satiety answer medication alter glucose/insulin metabolism Subjects diet treatment lose weight
